cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a new framework for text classification that involves generating category descriptions and using them to improve classification performance. This approach is related to natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, which are both subfields of computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on NLP and related topics. The paper also uses reinforcement learning to generate descriptions, which is a subfield of machine learning, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves information retrieval (IR) and computer vision (CV) tasks, which are both subfields of computer science and could be relevant sub-categories.
